title: Match Bases and Solve for $$x$$
text: $$\log_{10}\left(\frac{x-2}{4x+16}\right)=\log_{10}\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)$$ Since both sides has the same base, we can take out the logarithm and get $$\frac{x-2}{4x+16}=\frac{1}{x}$$. We can cross multiply and get $$x^2-2x=4x+16$$. We can simplify it into $$x^2-6x-16=0$$. We can factor the quadratic and get $$\left(x-8\right) \left(x+2\right)=0$$ which gives $$x=-2$$ and $$x=8$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer. Therefore $$x=8$$ is the only solution for this equation.
